subject: Programming
title: The Church-Turing Thesis
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Church-Turing Thesis.

hook.text: Can any computing device â€” present or future â€” solve problems a Turing machine can't?

buildup.text: The Church-Turing thesis says no. Every effective computation can be done by a Turing machine.

discovery.text: Alonzo Church and Alan Turing independently reached this conclusion using different approaches.

twist.text: It's a thesis, not a theorem. It can't be proven, but no counterexample has ever been found.

climax.text: If true, computation has a universal ceiling. No technology will ever surpass it.

punchline.text: All computers share the same fundamental limits.

quiz.question: What does the Church-Turing thesis claim?
options: All computation can be done by a Turing machine
Quantum computers are the most powerful
